data.title: Ray Allen, Basketball Player
data.meta_description: Ray Allen stats and bio. Stats averages season by season. Quick access to game by game stats.
data.text:
Ray Allen - Points

Ray Allen scores a career high 54 points (2007)

On January 12, 2007, Ray Allen set his career high in points in a NBA game. That day he scored 54 points in Seattle's home win against Utah, 122-114. He also had 10 rebounds, 5 assists, 1 steal. He shot 9/20 from two, 8/12 from three, shooting at 53.1% from the field. He also shot 12/12 from the free-throw line.

Ray Allen - Rebounds

Ray Allen grabs a career high 13 rebounds (2002)

On February 22, 2002, Ray Allen tied his career high in rebounds in a NBA game. That day he grabbed 13 rebounds in Milwaukee's home win against Golden State, 116-112. He also had 28 points, 8 assists, 1 steal.

Ray Allen - Assists

Ray Allen gives a career high 13 assists (2000)

On January 20, 2000, Ray Allen tied his career high in assists in a NBA game. That day he dished 13 assists in Milwaukee's home loss against Seattle, 96-104. He also had 11 points, 5 rebounds.

Ray Allen - Steals

Ray Allen has a career high 6 steals (2001)

On January 03, 2001, Ray Allen tied his career high in steals in a NBA game. That day he reached 6 steals in Milwaukee's home win against Cleveland, 88-83. He also had 25 points, 4 rebounds and 4 assists.

Ray Allen - Blocks

Ray Allen blocks a career high 2 shots (2000)

On November 25, 2000, Ray Allen tied his career high in blocks in a NBA game. That day he went for 2 blocks in Milwaukee's road loss against Washington, 107-100. He also had 37 points, 7 rebounds and 5 assists.

Ray Allen - Efficiency

Ray Allen records a career high 53 efficiency rating (2007)

On January 12, 2007, Ray Allen set his career high in efficiency in a NBA game. That day he accomplished 53 efficiency in Seattle's home win against Utah, 122-114. He also had 54 points, 10 rebounds and 5 assists.
